title: Autofill means fill not troll
body: If you get autofilled I feel for you. I do. It sucks. But that does not give you an excuse to be a dick. If you get autofilled into support then SUPPORT. Don't play any champ you feel like and screw over your ADC. You don't have to be the best at all the roles but at least know HOW to do them. Otherwise its just going to be a bad game for your team and yourself.

replies.body:
I think a lot of time what happens is people are getting filled into roles *they don't know how to play*. There really should be some kind of gate in front of ranked where you don't get to queue up until you've played a certain number of games each role.

Quite honestly I'd take the longer queue times if it meant autofill went away. It's *always* an annoyance, and if you get filled into a role you don't like (or even aren't that good at), it's making the team less likely to win. Give me 20 minute queues where every player got the role they picked vs sub minute queues where my jungler doesn't want to jungle.
Any champ can support. Some are better at it than others, but just because it doesn't fit your desired support does not mean they're prohibited from playing it.

I have had my fill of playing roles I don't want to for the years and years that pick order was dependent on ELO and there were no assigned roles. Since then Riot fixed the problem and THEN added in autofill that makes me rather just not play the game. As someone else said here, I'd rather sit in queue for 15 minutes and watch youtube videos or something and get the role I want and play with 4 people who got the role they wanted than a fast queue where that doesn't always happen. The thing that is so infuriating is that we HAD this for one season and they took it away (s5?). Honestly my favorite queue so far was back when they did teamfill normals or whatever it was. When they was an option that was always what I played when not grinding ranked. Everyone picks their champ and position and it assigned you other people playing different positions and you could turn down people playing troll shit. If I want to not queue for support and sit and wait for 10+ minutes that's my choice, and I'd gladly make it many times over.
Side note: if you're support, BUY A SIGHTSTONE! I wish not buying it were a bannable offense.

To be honest it totally depends on the MMR you're in. I'd assume at some point you're going to find players who don't support generally don't know how or what to do and when to do it and would rather try to be the 'carry' because they want to be the reason for winning. Going back to our discussion before, there is a lack of knowledge between what is a viable support and what really is just a 'trolling' player - as you know, everything is possible and some configurations work better than others. Was I mad today when I had a Signed support, no though I tried to recommend he not do so against Sona, but I am not going to get all in his face when the lane itself fails because it wasn't the best matchup for the lane. Late game I was thankful he went signed because everyone ended up chasing him nonstop and we won - so I think this comes as no surprise, but knowing the game and being open to things really helps.
